results.content: I liked the course, perfect pace. For those who say he sounds boring click on the speed of video tab and increase the pace. Or simply go to the W3C homepage and forget about learning it from someone who can respond to you. I can tell you from experience you would learn it slow and tedious like I did a few years back then gave up on their documentation on animations and transforms.

results.content: Examples basic and good -- information good -- voice affected and slow. I find myself skipping to the next one in midstream because I "got it" already. I suppose if this were the first time I had ever heard of HTML or CSS, it would give me time to write stuff down, but the pause button also helps there. Overall, though, it's exactly what I needed. I'm a self-taught eBook formatter and the course has filled in some gaps.

results.content: This course is giving me background basics/fundamentals  of CSS3 and HTML5 and this will allow me to take more advanced hands on and practicle courses down the road.
